function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Downward ventilation may not always protect people from cross-infection due to mixing ventilation and free convection around the human body.","Impact":"Increased risk of cross-infection in clean rooms, infectious wards, and operating theaters.","Mitigation":"Consider alternative ventilation methods and air distribution to minimize the risk of cross-infection.","Technologies":"Air purifiers, HEPA filters, UVGI systems.","People":"Patients, healthcare workers, visitors.","Owner":"Facility management, healthcare administrators, engineering and design teams."},{"Description":"Displacement ventilation performs worse when patients are lying sideways, leading to the persistence of exhalation jets over a long distance.","Impact":"Increased risk of spreading respiratory pathogens and decreased air quality in healthcare settings.","Mitigation":"Optimize ventilation systems for different patient positions and consider the use of air curtains or barriers to contain exhalation jets.","Technologies":"Air curtains, barrier systems, directional airflow control.","People":"Patients, healthcare workers, visitors.","Owner":"Facility management, healthcare administrators, engineering and design teams."},{"Description":"Increasing the throw of the supply jet from the floor diffuser can deteriorate inhaled air quality and promote resuspension of particles including those carrying respiratory pathogens.","Impact":"Increased risk of respiratory pathogen transmission and reduced air quality in indoor environments.","Mitigation":"Optimize the design and airflow direction of floor diffusers to minimize particle resuspension and improve air quality.","Technologies":"Smart diffusers, directional airflow control, air purifiers.","People":"Occupants of indoor spaces.","Owner":"Building owners, facility management, engineering and design teams."},{"Description":"Dilution ventilation may lead to local thermal discomfort and increased energy use, limiting its effectiveness in controlling pathogens in indoor environments.","Impact":"Inefficient control of pathogens and increased energy costs in indoor environments.","Mitigation":"Invest in energy-efficient ventilation systems and consider alternative approaches to pathogen control, such as filtration and UVGI.','Technologies':'Energy-efficient ventilation systems, filtration systems, UVGI systems.","People":"Occupants of indoor environments.","Owner":"Building owners, facility management, engineering and design teams."},{"Description":"The proximity of people in densely occupied spaces increases the risk of disease transmission by contact and droplet transmission despite the use of dilution ventilation.","Impact":"High risk of disease transmission in densely occupied spaces.","Mitigation":"Implement additional measures such as physical distancing, masking, and hand hygiene to complement ventilation strategies.","Technologies":"HVAC zoning, air purification systems, directional airflow control.","People":"Occupants of densely occupied spaces.","Owner":"Facility management, event organizers, transportation companies."}]}
